gobblin.writer.commands

Class MySqlWriterCommands

  • java.lang.Object
    • gobblin.writer.commands.MySqlWriterCommands
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    JdbcBufferedInserter, JdbcWriterCommands

    public class MySqlWriterCommands
extends Object
implements JdbcWriterCommands
    The implementation of JdbcWriterCommands for MySQL.

    • Method Detail

      • insert

        public void insert(String databaseName,
                   String table,
                   JdbcEntryData jdbcEntryData)
            throws SQLException
        Description copied from interface: JdbcBufferedInserter
        Inserts entry. Depends on the current batch size, buffer size, param size, it can either put into buffer or it will actually call underlying JDBC RDBMS to be inserted. The number of input columns is expected to be equal or smaller than the number of columns in Jdbc. This is to prevent unintended outcome from schema evolution such as additional column. As underlying Jdbc RDBMS can declare constraints on its schema, writer will allow if number of columns in Jdbc is greater than number of input columns. number of input columns <= number of columns in Jdbc
        Specified by:
        insert in interface JdbcBufferedInserter
        Throws:
        SQLException

           throws SQLException

        public void createTableStructure(String fromStructure,
                                 String targetTableName)
                          throws SQLException
        Description copied from interface: JdbcWriterCommands
        Creates table structure based on the table in parameter. Note that this won't guarantee copy exactly the same as original table such as restraints, foreign keys, sequences, indices, etc
